p: Upon the initial examination, the Glasgow Coma Scale (GCS) score of the patient was E4 V5 M6. He had a heart rate of 120 beats per minute and had hypotension (70/40 mm of Hg). There was no heart murmur or pericardial rub and his pulmonary examination was unremarkable. The skin showed no rashes, and there were no petechiae or jaundice.
